comment: Brave of Rachel for stepping forward in the Amber Heard era. This was exactly what pissed me off about Amber. Women like her is the reason why real female victims don't get believed when they do step forward. She tries to look like the face of abused women, when she is part of the problem for abused women. There is a very clear difference in attitude when the victim is a woman though. People look for any reason not to believe them. 'why did she not say anything earlier' and 'she's just looking for attention' is something no one ever says when the victim is male. That attitude is saved purely for women. Fake accusations such as Amber is RARE but still EVERY woman has to hear those things when stepping forward. Johnny depp didn't step forward directly either, but that was never used as an excuse to not believe him. Not once. This is why people say 'BELIEVE WOMEN', because people tend to assume women are lying, simply because they are women. No one is saying 'believe women blindly even if there is mountains of evidence against them.'  The believe women-movement has been wildly misunderstood and taken advantage of. Either way, Amber need to stay away from Rachel, she can only make things worse.

comment:
What really ticks me off about AH is that she has no authentic persona. She is a chameleon, always copying others. Keira Knightleys' very own smile for example. Didn't have it before but you can see as of when she started trying it. Nicole Kidman, she copies her too, big time. And as for that name, Slim, she used when texting JD. That is from the classic 'To have or have not' movie with Humphrey Bogart. It was Lauren Bacalls' first film, her nickname on it was Slim. She met Bogart there on set and they fell in love real time. Bacall was also about 20 years younger than Bogart. AH did mention dating an 'old man' as the 2 started out. I think she modelled a lot of her persona on Bacalls' back. Age difference, falling in love on set. You can even see her trying to copy Bacalls' The Look, chin down and eyes up. Bacall was real, she explained it was because she was shy and felt overwhelmed. AH just tried to copy it. Was aH hoping her 'old' husband would also die soon of cancer? Obviously JD is too healthy and it would be too long for her to play the role of supporting, loving wife. Lauren Bacall really loved Humphry, she was there at the end. And truly suffered losing him.
AH is cheap.
Excuse the rant, been wanting to bring up this To have or have not thing for a while. Many people don't know why AH called herself Slim
